reviewText: This is an impressive collection. PUMPKINHEAD- Lance Henriksen's chance to shine as the vengeful father, out to repay those who have killed his son. Unfortunately for everyone, the title character is a hideous, unstoppable demon, that makes the one who summoned it sorry that they ever heard its name! DOLLS- Horror-meister, Stuart Gordon's excellent "killer doll" movie! Don't worry, their victims are a reprehensible group of annoying, sinister types. INVASION OF THE BODY SNATCHERS (1978)- Donald Sutherland (DON'T LOOK NOW), Brooke Adams (SHOCK WAVES, THE DEAD ZONE), and Leonard Nimoy (SPOCK himself!) star in this sci-fi / horror masterwork! Aliens attempt world domination by replacing us w/ inhuman duplicates! SCARECROWS- A team of bank-robbers believe that they've gotten away w/ their crime, until they end up at an abandoned farmhouse in the middle of nowhere. They soon find themselves up against supernatural forces they hadn't counted on! Cornfields have never been this creepy! SOMETIMES THEY COME BACK- Tim Matheson (IMPULSE) plays a teacher who encounters specters from his past in this decent Stephen King adaptation. These ghosts are not satisfied w/ merely haunting him, they want him dead! Brooke Adams co-stars. RAW MEAT- As if the London underground wasn't frightening enough at night, now it's got a cannibalistic humanoid problem! Can Donald Pleasance (HALLOWEEN 1 and 2, FREAKMAKER) get to the bottom of the many disappearances before it's too late? Low-key and dread-inducing. This 6-movie set is a fantastic starter-kit for the horror enthusiast...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Set actually consists of three double-sided discs-- not six as Amazon describes-- which are configured as follows:  'Pumpkinhead' (1989, 3 stars)/'Dolls' (1987, 2 stars), both presented in fullscreen format; 'Invasion of the Body Snatchers' (1978, 4 1/2 stars), letterboxed/'Scarecrows' (1988, 2 stars), anamorphic widescreen; and 'Sometimes They Come Back' (1991, 2 stars)/'Raw Meat' (1973, 3 stars), both anamorphic widescreen.  The only classic here is 'Body Snatchers,' although 'Pumpkinhead' and 'Raw Meat' have achieved something of a cult standing among horror fans.  The remaining three films are marginal entertainments, fairly low-rent and largely forgettable.  Negatives: No extras aside from trailers, flippers are said to decay faster than single-sided DVDs, and two of the titles are cut to a 4:3 aspect ratio (and the best movie included is non-anamorphic).  Positive: At less than 15 dollars, a very good value for the three better features alone (and if you enjoy any of the others, there's your gravy).  3 stars overall.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was really happy to get this 6 pack of movies. Especially since a few of them are out of print.  But what turned out to be joy end up the total opposite. All these movies look like they were ripped from VHS.  Very dark, and hard to make out anything going on.  My advice is to try to find these movies separately as you will be very unhappy with picture quality.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: David J. Turner "Idiots with guns make me ner...
reviewText: Here, we have 6 movies spread out across 3 discs, with 1 film on each side. This means that each side can support the standard film and special features, because regarding rendering and compression rates, it's typically not the preferred practice to cram several movies on 1 side of a disc.Pumpkinhead is the full screen version though, but every movie is plenty of fun. You've got Stan Winston's Pumpkinhead with Lance Henriksen, Stuart Gordon's Dolls, a killer scarecrow movie, some British sewer dwelling movie with Donald Pleasence, a Stephen King movie, and body snatchers. What a wide range of horrors!

reviewText: This packaging of movies is intentionally designed to rip off fans. Both Pumpkinhead and Invasion of the Body Snatchers are MGM's old, non-remastered prints. Pumpkinhead's in full-screen and this print is desperately in need of remastering (which is why it was re-released in 2008... years before this set came out) and Body Snatchers looks dull, soft, and is non-anamorphic!! So, you just got screwed. You give me one reason to buy this set if you don't get quality versions of the only 2 certified cult movies in this set? Oh, Dolls is here too. But do you know what Fox did to that movie?? They not only give you fullscreen on that too, but they completely stripped it of bonus features. It's the only disc I already have in this set and it wasn't more than $10 (like Pumpkinhead currently is- if this set doesn't exist to give us any kind of actual DEAL, what the hell is it here for?) and it was a double-sided disc. I think both sides had the commentaries and video features. Not this one.This set is one of the biggest rip-offs I've ever encountered. Fox are spineless cretins and have no right owning these titles if they're not going to give them a quality packaging. And some people paid nearly $15 for this set. At $12 (what I paid)- it's plain and simple robbery. $6 for Scarecrows is nothing to complain about. But this set practically exists to make a penny on Sometimes They Come Back in your face, one of the worst horror movies I've ever seen. If Raw Meat is a masterpiece, just maybe buying this set won't be the worst decision I've ever made. Either way, Fox need to be taken to task for this release. Especially since the discs in my brand new package are marked, scratched, and scuffed all over. This was never opened and it's already damaged.
summary: Fox Doesn't Care About Movie Fans Either
